Sentence.sentence: In an era of instant information, shoppers can use their mobile phones to find deals.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The wireless age is expanding to include not just our phones, tablets, and laptops, but also our cars, homes,  and even whole communities.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Not only that, it supports a number of  platforms: Apple's i OS, Google's Android and Microsoft's Windows phone.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But after she snapped a photo and started using her phone, he asked her a serious question: "Are you going to post that online?"
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: But there's still someone who deserves scrutiny—the person holding the phone.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: By the end of 2013, Nokia had sold its phone business to Microsoft.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: From a societal perspective, phone checking is less like belching in public and more like another bad habit.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: If after work you lie around on your bed and get irritated by political commentary on your phone or get stressed thinking about decisions about how to renovate your home, your brain has not received a break from high mental arousal states.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: In 2007, Nokia accounted for more than 40% of mobile phone sales worldwide.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Many people, it seems, are uneasy living in a thickening cloud of radio waves from mobile phone towers and the gadgets they communicate with.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Mobile phone champion Nokia, one of Europe's biggest technology success stories, was no 26 exception, losing its market share in just a few years.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Now, imagine the same dinner, but instead of checking their phone, the person belches—loudly.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: On Jan 9, 2007, Steve Jobs formally announced Apple's "revolutionary mobile phone"—a device that combined the functionality of an iPod, phone and Internet communication into a single unit, navigated by touch.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: On the one side, you have the United States government's mighty legal and security apparatus fighting for data of the most sympathetic sort: the secrets buried in a dead mass murderer' phone.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Once one person looks at their phone, other people feel compelled to do the same, starting a chain reaction.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: She suggests downloading the Instant or Moment apps to see how many times you turn on your phone each day.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Smith says he'll provide services ranging from formal seminars to on-farm workshops on holistic management, to one-on-one hand-holding and an almost 24/7 phone hotline for farmers who are converting.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The average person turns on their phone 150 times every day.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The number of devices you can talk to is multiplying—first it was your phone, then your car, and now you can tell your kitchen appliances what to do.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: The reality is, taking one's phone out at the wrong time is worse than belching because, unlike other minor offense, checking tech is contagious.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The rise of the mobile phone has recently added a new level of complexity to the process of retail reinvention.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Through regular regional educational meetings, a large annual meeting, individual farm visits and thousands of phone calls, the Amburghs pass on the principles of pasture management.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: When college students were reminded of a time they had been excluded in a social setting, they compensated by exaggerating their number of friends—unless they were first given tasks that caused them to interact with their phone as if it had human qualitie
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: When Tm doing something I'd rather not do, or when I'm someplace I'd rather not be, I use my phone to port myself elsewhere.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

slang.tokens: talk on the big white phone

example.en: One more beer and I'm gonna have to go talk on the big white phone.
example.zh: 再多喝一杯啤酒，我就非要跑到洗手间去呕吐不可怜。

Sentence.sentence: A lot of business is still done over the phone, and much of it is based on trust and existing relationships.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: And mp3 players, smart phones, and LCD TVs entered homes in 2002, before tablets and e-readers showed up in 2007.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷I 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: I couldn't reach anyone at the phone number on the cat's tag.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 完形填空 A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Before he knew it, Nicholas was lost, all alone! he didn't have food, water, a phone, or other supplies.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Cell-phones are part of a growing mountain of electronic waste like computers and personal digital assistants.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Consider again the cell-phone, and imagine the mines that produced those metals, the factories needed to make the box and packaging (包装) It came in.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Desktop computers, basic mobile phones, and box-set TVs defined 1992.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷I 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Digital technology—email and smart phones especially—have vastly improved workers' ability to be productive outside of a traditional office.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（10月） 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: For years I dealt with my travel agent only by phone.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷2 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: From what I have seen, few do homework; instead many are on their phones and talking, making it impossible for those who actually want to do work to complete any.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖南卷 阅读表达 原文

Sentence.sentence: He can't help checking even at inappropriate times like when we are eating in a restaurant and I am talking to him! he behaves as if any small amount of boredom can make him feel the need to check his phone even when he knows he shouldn't.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 语法填空 B 原文

Sentence.sentence: He has a constant urge to check for text messages; he checks his phone every five minutes! He's so addicted to it that he just can't stand the idea that there may be an important text.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 语法填空 B 原文

Sentence.sentence: He likes that he can sit and check his phone in peace or chat up the barkeeper with whom he's on a first-name basis if he wants to have a little interaction.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: I absent-mindedly turned the pages of the phone book and came across a city map.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（10月） 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: I now regularly pull out my phone to check a fact, watch a video, read weibo.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 任务型阅读 原文

Sentence.sentence: I want to fix my cell phone.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: If we go somewhere and I ask him to leave the phone at home, he suffers from withdrawal symptoms.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 语法填空 B 原文

Sentence.sentence: In the 1950s in the usa, most families had just one phone at home, and wireless phones hadn't been invented yet.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: In the United States alone, over 100 million cell-phones are thrown away each year.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Late in the evening, the phone rang.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: My husband answered it while I was on the phone in the dining room.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语天津卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Once, a passenger next to me talked out loud on his mobile phone.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Only five years after Steve Jobs' death, smart-phones defeated conventional PCs in sales.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: People of all ages happily walk along the pavement with eyes and hands glued to the mobile phone, quite unaware of what is going on around them.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖南卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Phone carriers and consumers need to work together to find ways of determining and communicating what is real.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: The ad had a phone number for a town in southern Michigan.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷2 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: The bicycles will have smart phones attached to the handlebars measuring how much power is being generated for the hotel.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（10月） 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: The doctor shares his phone number with the patients in case they need medical assistance.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语江苏卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: The girl's parents got rashid's phone number from a letter in his papers.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读A 题设

Sentence.sentence: The passenger made an apology to angie o'edema because he spoke very loudly on his phone.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 阅读理解 阅读C 题设

Sentence.sentence: The professor warned the students that on no account should they use mobile phones in his class.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语天津卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: The report said they also faced pressure to respond to messages at all hours of the day—especially at secondary school when more youngsters have mobile phones.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Then, one day, the phone rang and Steve Tregear, the Coastguard of Cornwall, asked holder if he would like his dog bark.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语陕西卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: They were prevented from using mobile phones.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: To enjoy the convenience of digital payment, many senior citizens started to use smart phones.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语江苏卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Today, a man talked very loud on his phone on a train between malvern and reading, making many passengers upset.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Walking while using phones hurts one's eyes.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖南卷 阅读理解 阅读A 选项

Sentence.sentence: When his phone rang again later, he left his seat to answer it.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: When I ask him to please put down the phone and stop ignoring me, he says, "In a minute," but still checks to see if someone has posted something new on the Internet.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 语法填空 B 原文

Sentence.sentence: When most of us get a text message on our cell phone from an unknown person, we usually say "Sorry?"
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷3 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: You can sell the phone, and it can be recycled.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: You left it by the phone.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: This is hacking on an industrial scale ,as was acknowledged by Glenn Mulcaire, the man hired by the News of the World in 2001 to be the point person for phone hacking.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: They should start by discarding California’s lame argument that exploring the contents of a smart phone — a vast storehouse of digital information — is similar to, say, rifling through a suspect’s purse.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: They could still invalidate Fourth Amendment protections when facing severe, urgent circumstances, and they could take reasonable measures to ensure that phone data are not erased or altered while a warrant is pending.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Just how much does the Constitution protect your digital data? The Supreme Court will now consider whether police can search the contents of a mobile phone without a warrant if the phone is on or around a person during an arrest.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In many respects, the dearth of moral purpose frames not only the fact of such widespread phone hacking but the terms on which the trial took place.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In many cases, it would not be overly onerous for authorities to obtain a warrant to search through phone contents.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But exploring one’s smart phone is more like entering his or her home.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: As the hacking trial concludes – finding guilty ones-editor of the News of the World, Andy Coulson, for conspiring to hack phones ,and finding his predecessor, Rebekah Brooks, innocent of the same charge –the winder issue of dearth of integrity still standstill, Journalists are known to have hacked the phones of up to 5,500 people.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: A smart phone may contain an arrestee’s reading history, financial history, medical history and comprehensive records of recent correspondence.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Simply arranging a meeting, making a phone call, or hosting an event is not an official act.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But exploring one's smart phone is more like entering his or her home.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: But you wouldn't know it, plugged into your phone.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语二）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: Facebook promised the European commission then that it would not link phone numbers to Facebook identities, but it broke the promise almost as soon as the deal went through.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Fast-food chains should also stop offering "inducements" such as toys, cute animals and mobile phone credit to lure young customers, Stephenson said.
Sentence.come: 2011年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Few of us just walk straight into the woods without a phone.
Sentence.come: 2019年考研真题（英语一）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: If you get lost without a phone or a compass, and you  literally can't find north, a few tricks to help you navigate back  to civilization, one of which is to follow the land.
Sentence.come: 2019年考研真题（英语一）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: Imagine you are pouring your heart out to someone and they are just busy on their phone, and if you ask for their attention you get the response "I can multitask".
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: In many cases, it would not be overly burdensome for authorities to obtain a warrant to search through phone contents.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: In many respects, the dearth of moral purpose frames not only the fact of such widespread phone hacking but the terms on which the trial took place .
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: simply arranging a meeting, making a phone call, or hosting an event is not an "official act".
Sentence.come: 2017年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: The Supreme Court will now consider whether police can search the contents of a mobile phone without a warrant if the phone is on or around a person during an arrest.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: They could still invalidate Fourth Amendment protections when facing severe, urgent circumstances, and they could take reasonable measures to ensure that phone data are not erased or altered while waiting for a warrant.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: They should start by discarding California's lame argument that exploring the contents of a smart phone—a vast storehouse of digital information—is similar to, say, going through a suspect's purse.

sentences.en: If you have no other business, you may hang up the phone.
sentences.cn: 如果你没有其他事, 你就可以挂机了。

means.word_mean: （发声或使用声音的）工具，仪器
说某种语言的；讲某种语言的人

sentences.en: We must phone for a doctor at once.
sentences.cn: 我们必须马上打电话请医生。

sentences.en: Mary phoned that her son was lost.
sentences.cn: 玛丽打电话来说她儿子失踪了。

sentences.en: She phoned me that she was leaving by the first train.
sentences.cn: 她打电话告诉我说她要乘首班车走。</seg>

entry.def: The phone is an electrical system that you use to talk to someone else in another place, by dialling a number on a piece of equipment and speaking into it.

example.ex: You can buy insurance over the phone...
example.tran: 你可以通过电话购买保险。

example.ex: She looked forward to talking to her daughter by phone...
example.tran: 她盼望着能打电话和女儿交谈。

entry.def: The phone is the piece of equipment that you use when you dial someone's phone number and talk to them.

example.ex: Two minutes later the phone rang...
Doug's 14-year-old son Jamie answered the phone.
example.tran: 道格14岁的儿子杰米接了电话。

entry.def: If you say that someone picks up or puts down the phone, you mean that they lift or replace the receiver.

example.ex: She picked up the phone, and began to dial Maurice Campbell's number...
example.tran: 她拿起电话听筒，开始拨打莫里斯·坎贝尔的号码。

example.ex: Trembling, she put the phone down. It rang again almost immediately.
example.tran: 她颤抖着放下电话听筒，电话几乎立刻又响了起来。

entry.def: When you phone someone, you dial their phone number and speak to them by phone.

example.ex: He'd phoned Laura to see if she was better...
example.tran: 他打电话给劳拉看她是不是好些了。

example.ex: I got more and more angry as I waited for her to phone.
example.tran: 我等她电话的时候，越等越生气。

entry.def: If you say that someone is on the phone, you mean that they are speaking to someone else by phone.

example.ex: She's always on the phone, wanting to know what I've been up to.
example.tran: 她老来电话，想知道我在做什么。

entry.def: If you are on the phone, you have a phone in your home or place of work, so that you can be contacted by phone.
entry.tran: 装了电话的；可用电话联系的

example.ex: The Frosts were not on the phone.

means.word_mean: 1. electronic equipment that converts sound into electrical signals that can be transmitted over distances and then converts received signals back into sounds;

sentences.sentence: "I talked to him on the telephone"

means.word_mean: 2. (phonetics) an individual sound unit of speech without concern as to whether or not it is a phoneme of some language
3. electro-acoustic transducer for converting electric signals into sounds; it is held over or inserted into the ear;

sentences.sentence: "it was not the typing but the earphones that she disliked"

means.word_mean: 1. get or try to get into communication (with someone) by telephone;

sentences.sentence: "I tried to call you all night"
"Take two aspirin and call me in the morning"

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from Greek phōnē 'sound, voice'

sentences.cn: 福罗斯特家没装电话。
sentences.en: The Frosts were not on the phone.

sentences.cn: 他不想被电话打扰，就把电话听筒摘下来了。
sentences.en: He left the phone off the hook as he didn't want to be disturbed.

sentences.cn: 她拿起电话听筒，开始拨打莫里斯·坎贝尔的号码。
sentences.en: She picked up the phone, and began to dial Maurice Campbell's number...

sentences.cn: 她颤抖着放下电话听筒，电话几乎立刻又响了起来。
sentences.en: Trembling, she put the phone down. It rang again almost immediately.

sentences.cn: 他们摘下电话听筒,以免电话打扰他们.
sentences.en: They took the phone off the hook so no calls would disturb them.

sentences.cn: 听筒将会以被接受者做的任何行动挂断.
sentences.en: The phone will hang up with any action done by the recipient.

sentences.cn: 上帝拿起听筒, 他就问: “ 上帝, 为什么女人那么容易哭 呢 ? ”
sentences.en: When God got on the phone, he asked, " God, why do women cry so easily? "

sentences.cn: 他每天早上都会骑脚踏车散步,同时还一边用戴在头上的听筒打电话.
sentences.en: Walks on a treadmill every morning while making phone calls with a headset.

sentences.cn: 正在这时,电话铃响了, 莱斯立刻冲过去,拿起听筒.
sentences.en: When the phone rang, Les pounced on it.

sentences.cn: 他不把电话听筒挂上.以免受到打扰.
sentences.en: He left the phone hook so that he wouldn't be disturbed.

sentences.cn: 电话铃响了,我拿起听筒.
sentences.en: I picked up the receiver as the phone rang.

sentences.cn: 对照于现实生活中的驾驶行为,本研究认为驾车时使用免持听筒行动电话,仍然存在着潜在的危害.
sentences.en: The results suggest that using cellular phone would lead to decrement on detection task during driving.

sentences.cn: 扎达克放下听筒, 站起身, 离开了他的房间.
sentences.en: Zadak put the phone down, stood up, and left his room.

sentences.cn: 如果想挂断电话, 请按下靠近听筒顶端的插簧.
sentences.en: To release the phone, push back the button near the top of the holder.

sentences.cn: 微笑着拿起电话听筒, 对方将从你的声音中听出它来.
sentences.en: TWENTY . Smile when picking up the phone. caller will hear it in your voice.

sentences.cn: 如篮牙技术, 它通过无线听筒设备与移动电话相连.
sentences.en: An example is Bluetooth, which is used to link mobile phones with earpieces.

sentences.cn: 她在拿起听筒前犹豫了一下.
sentences.en: She hesitated before picking up the phone.

sentences.cn: 他们摘下听筒,以免电话干扰他们.
sentences.en: They took left the phone off the hook so no calls would disturb them.

sentences.cn: 电话听筒没有挂上.
sentences.en: The phone was off the hook.

sentences.cn: 西蒙拨完号，把听筒贴在耳边。
sentences.en: Simon finished dialing and clamped the phone to his ear.

sentences.cn: 她拿起电话听筒，开始拨打莫里斯·坎贝尔的号码。
sentences.en: She picked up the phone, and began to dial Maurice Campbell's number.

sentences.cn: 她颤抖着放下电话听筒，电话几乎立刻又响了起来。
sentences.en: Trembling, she put the phone down. It rang again almost immediately.

sentences.cn: 很多人似乎对生活在由手机信号塔和通讯工具所产生的不断加厚的无线电波云中而感到不安。
sentences.en: Many people, it seems, are uneasy living in a thickening cloud of radio waves from mobile phone towers and the gadgets they communicate with.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 安装摩托罗拉手机工具可能会影响这个驱动的表现.
sentences.en: Installation of Motorola's Mobile Phone Tools may affect the performance of this driver.

sentences.cn: 代理测试集是电讯工作人员用来检测电话线路问题的一种工具.
sentences.en: Proctor Test Set is a tool used by Telco personnel to diagnose problems with phone lines.

sentences.cn: 手机是使用最频繁的通讯工具了.
sentences.en: Mobile phones are the most frequently used communicating tool.

sentences.cn: 毕竟, 电话只是一个工具.
sentences.en: After all, a phone is just a tool.

sentences.cn: 解密类游戏, 手机工具逃离雪地.
sentences.en: Decryption games, mobile phone tools to escape snow.

sentences.cn: 移动电话是一个非常有趣的手持设备,电话不是卫星设备, 它们是主要的通信工具.
sentences.en: Phones are not satellite devices; they are primary communication devices.

sentences.cn: 创建一个博客,并将它作为主要的营销工具.
sentences.en: Create a blog and use it as a primary marketing tool for your i Phone app.

sentences.cn: 手机是被用来检验这种捏造出来的假物质工具.
sentences.en: Mobile phones are supposedly employed as instruments to prove the existence of the phony substance.

sentences.cn: 移动电话已经成为了我们生活中不可缺少的工具.
sentences.en: Mobile phones have become an indispensable tool in our life.

sentences.cn: 小工具来控制手机完整的源代码可以直接使用的考验.
sentences.en: A Gadget to control a phone complete code can be directly used by the test.

sentences.cn: 安装“连接管理器管理工具”和“电话簿服务”.
sentences.en: Installs Connection Manager Administration Kit and the Phone Book Service.

sentences.cn: 他给凯特打电话讲了一个多小时了。
sentences.en: He's been on the phone to Kate for more than an hour.

sentences.cn: 我只是打电话聊聊天。
sentences.en: I was just phoning up for a chat.

sentences.cn: 他打电话请我外出吃饭。
sentences.en: He phoned to invite me out for dinner.

sentences.cn: 谁打电话叫辆救护车！
sentences.en: Someone phone for an ambulance!

sentences.cn: 您过一会儿再打电话来好吗？
sentences.en: Could you phone back later?

sentences.cn: 他往家里打电话，但没有人接。
sentences.en: He phoned home , but there was no reply.

sentences.cn: 别忘了往纽约打电话。
sentences.en: Don't forget to phone New York.

sentences.cn: 今天上午已有三个人打电话来请病假。
sentences.en: Three people have phoned in sick already this morning.

sentences.cn: 她盼望着能打电话和女儿交谈。
sentences.en: She looked forward to talking to her daughter by phone...

sentences.cn: 他打电话给劳拉看她是不是好些了。
sentences.en: He'd phoned Laura to see if she was better...

sentences.cn: 仅仅安排一次会见、打电话或举办活动都算不上“公务行为”。
sentences.en: Simply arranging a meeting, making a phone call, or hosting an event is not an “official act”.

sentences.cn: 假设你正在像某人倾吐心事，但他们却只是茅于接打电话，而当你寻求她们的关注时，就得到一句“我可以同时做很多事”这样的回复。
sentences.en: Imagine you are pouring your heart out to someone and they are just busy on their phone, and if you ask for their attention you get the response “I can multitask”

sentences.cn: 这位女士打电话的目的是什么？。
sentences.en: What is the woman’s purpose in making the phone call?.
sentences.from: 15年12月四级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 女士在打电话时往往会做什么？。
sentences.en: ?What does the woman tend to do while she is on the phone?.
sentences.from: 16年6月四级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 之后我会给你打电话， 但你可能还是得交一份申请表。
sentences.en: I’ll phone you afterwards, but perhaps you should put in an application anyway.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 但我在打电话时结束得很快。
sentences.en: But I get off the phone pretty  quickly  when  I  call.
sentences.from: 16年6月四级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 不要担心, 总有一天我会报复的.
sentences.en: Don't worry, I'm going to get even some day.

sentences.cn: 泰瑞试图打电话给杰克,但是杰克没有应答他的手机.
sentences.en: Teri tries calling Jack but her husband doesn't pick up his cell phone.

sentences.cn: 我说, 咱们谈话就像打电话似的.
sentences.en: I say, we are talking as if we were on the phone!

sentences.cn: 贝克先生打电话给那家餐馆.
sentences.en: Mr. Bakon is phoning the restaurant.

sentences.cn: 一边打电话,一边操作电脑的能力.
sentences.en: The ability to work on a computer while conducting phone calls.

sentences.cn: 所以这样好了,你打电话给联合国的秘书长.
sentences.en: So why don't you get me the Secretary General of the United Nations on the phone.

sentences.cn: 安德烈打电话到帕默所住的套房,要求与杰克通话.
sentences.en: Andre phones the Palmer suite and speaks to Jack.

sentences.cn: 如果你想打电话,但电话占线, 那么,就请等几分钟,稍后再拨.
sentences.en: If you're phoning and the lines are busy, wait for a few minutes then try again.

sentences.cn: 这男孩总是和他的女朋友打电话.
sentences.en: That boy always on the phone with his girlfriend.

sentences.cn: 杰克打电话给帕默,请求与之一晤.
sentences.en: Jack phones Palmer and asks to see him.
